sn8.11:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggara Lotus Pond, together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.
sn8.11:4.2: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.
sn8.11:4.4: “The Buddha is staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggara Lotus Pond, together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.
sn8.11:4.5: And he outshines them all in beauty and glory.
sn8.11:4.6: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with appropriate verses?”
sn8.11:5.1: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his cupped palms toward the Buddha, and said:
sn8.11:5.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
sn8.11:5.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
sn8.11:5.4: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled the Buddha in his presence with appropriate verses.
sn8.11:6.1: “Like the moon on a cloudless night,
sn8.11:6.3: so too Aṅgīrasa, O great sage,
sn8.11:6.4: your glory outshines the entire world.”
